Miscellaneous Highlights: Garrison Mathews has been lethal from the right side of the court, shooting 66.7% from the right wing and right corner through the team's first nine games.
Clint Capela has been one of the best interior finishers in the NBA early on, shooting 82.2% at the rim.
The Hawks have increased their rim-shooting frequency and accuracy by 4.5% this season, ranking in the upper half of the league in both categories.
The Hawks rank third in points allowed in the paint per game on the season thus far.
The Hawks have turned nearly 70% of their steals into transition opportunities this season, scoring 1.44 points per possession on these plays.
Others: The Hawks are currently 3rd in Fanduel's NBA Championship odds.
The Hawks have been playing without two of their most important players for the majority of the season in De'Andre Hunter and Bogdan Bogdanovic.
The Hawks need to do a better job closing out on opposing shooters going forwards.
No team in the past 11 years has allowed their opponents to shoot better than 40% from three over the course of an entire season.
The Hawks' defense may be just good enough for them to cause a few ripples in the murky waters of the Eastern Conference if they can sustain this level of interior defense going forwards.
